result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur N. Callis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed until December 5, 2016 pending cmpletion of community service
Prior to starting community service, defendant must provide letter from community service establishment to Oneida County Clerk of Court for approval of community service by Judge O'Melia

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arthur N. Callis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Community Service - facility approved by Judge
From Defendant, mailing in payment in full but needs an extension for CS.  Extension will be granted upon receipt of payment.

ADDRESS INFO for Arthur N. Callis
Current: 14 Church St, Moosup, CT 06354 United States  (Effective: 11-17-2016)
Prior: 380 Woodland Heights Terrace, Rhinelander, WI 54501

11:05 a.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm112, 15tr703 and 15tr702. Sowinski statement to agreement. State moves to dismiss 15tr703 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Sowinski/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Defendant proposes weekly payments on fines. Defendant states that his uncle runs a counseling center in Norwich, CT and would be able to arrange for community service hours.
Court Sentence
15tr702
Fine - $762.00
Driver's license revocation - 6 months
AODA assessment and driver's safety plan

15cm112
Community Service - 40 hours
Jail - 15 days, imposed and stayed until December 5, 2016, pending completion of community service
Prior to starting community service, defendant must provide details of community service in writing (from community service) to Clerk of Court for approval by Judge.
Costs remitted.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 11:22 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.
1:22 p.m. Defendant Arthur N. Callis not in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15TR703/15TR702. No appearance. Court orders warrant remain active.
Voluntary appearance on July 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

04:07 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Arthur N. Callis not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 15tr702-703.  Court authorizes warrant and endorse $1,000.00 cash.

01:47 pm - Defendant Arthur N. Callis in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 15tr702-703.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
